listitem.para: Ends the current interactive pause, returning to the context of the PAUSE invocation that began it. If CONTINUE is given an input, that value is used as the output from the PAUSE. If not, the PAUSE does not output.
Exceptionally, the CONTINUE command can be used without its default input and without parentheses provided that nothing follows it on the instruction line.

listitem.programlisting:
TO MYPROG REPEAT 180 [RIGHT 2 IF 90=REPCOUNT [PAUSE]] PRINT "Done END
MYPROG Pausing...myprog Enter SHOW HEADING in Pause Mode dialog box and hit OK 180 Enter CONTINUE in Pause Box and hit OK Done
